Class FacebookSecurityController

  • java.lang.Object
    • play.mvc.Results
      • play.mvc.Controller
        • controllers.FacebookSecurityController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    play.mvc.Http.HeaderNames, play.mvc.Http.Status

    public class FacebookSecurityController
extends play.mvc.Controller
    Endpoint controller for handling requests for Facebook authorization.

    • Method Detail

      • getUser

        public static User getUser()

      • login

        public java.util.concurrent.CompletionStage<play.mvc.Result> login()
        Method for handling a request for authorization via Facebook. Accepts a Facebook access token, collects basic user data and uses the user id to make further requests for data to Facebook. Currently, the only further data collected is the first page of the user's list of friends. Sends a custom authentication token back on successful requests, to be used for authenticating further requests to the server. The access token should be provided in the header field represented by the AUTH_TOKEN_HEADER constant and the custom authentication token returned will be placed in the field represented by the AUTH_TOKEN constant.
        Returns:
        a status code and, given that the authorization was successful, a custom authentication token to be used in future communication with the server.

      • setAuthTokenCookie

        private void setAuthTokenCookie()

      • processUserData

        private java.lang.String processUserData(java.lang.String facebookToken,
                                         play.libs.ws.WSResponse userData)
        Takes data from Facebook and determines whether the user already exists or not, and creates or updates the user and its fields accordingly.
        Parameters:
        facebookToken - a Facebook authorization token.
        userData - a WSResponse object containing the user data.
        Returns:
        the user id extracted from the data.

      • setUserAttributes

        private void setUserAttributes(User user,
                               com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode userData,
                               java.lang.String facebookToken)
        Sets user attributes according to the data passed to the method. Only operates on existing users and will create a new FacebookData entry from the data passed.
        Parameters:
        user - the user to operate on.
        userData - the data to create a FacebookData entry from.
        facebookToken - the Facebook authorization token used to obtain the data. Will be included in the FacebookData entry for further use.
